message.content: This question requires knowledge about safety practices when using a pickax to break rocks. Option (B) is the correct answer because sweeping up after yourself helps to keep the workplace safe by removing any small pieces of rock that could cause someone to slip or trip. Option (A) is irrelevant because the location where lots of people will be does not affect the safety of using a pickax on rocks. Option (C) is incorrect because wearing safety gear, such as goggles and gloves, is important to protect oneself from injury. Option (D) is also incorrect because cleaning up after using a pickax is necessary to maintain a safe and organized workspace.

This question is related to safety practices when using a pickax to break rocks. Option (B) is the correct answer because it emphasizes the importance of keeping the workplace safe by sweeping up after oneself. Rocks and debris left on the ground can create tripping hazards. Option (A) is unrelated to safety and focuses on the location where people will be, which is not relevant to the question. Option (C) is incorrect because wearing safety gear, such as goggles or gloves, is important to protect oneself from potential injuries. Option (D) is incorrect because cleaning up after using a pickax is necessary to maintain a safe working environment.
